page.title: 19Energy_Oil
page.content: {January 1985} There was great excitement in the small village of Little Ponton in January 1985, when B.P. announced their intentions of drilling atest borings for oil at Lodge Farm Stroxton This follows a seismic survey of the area which showed favourable results. The exploration was given the goahead by Lincolnshires Transportation and Planning sub-committee. It would take 6 weeks to sink 1 well and if these results looked promising opperations would increase. In there Quest for oil the B.P.men must keep to strict rules. Machinery must be quiet and there must be a proper access route to the drilling site.The local people of the area had no objections to this project, provided there is no discharge into water courses.Some people see{(cont)
